definition: no profit/not profitable/a hindrance/(to lend money) at no interest
harmful and without benefit (idiom); more harm than good

sentences.english: I'm afraid you're backed a loser there this time, old chap.
sentences.chinese: 老夥計，恐怕你的生意這次是無利可圖。

sentences.english: Nor if they thought there were no profits to be made.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們認爲無利可圖，也不會這樣做。

sentences.english: However, no benefit is unfaithful minister, the official fiscal few more, nothing?
sentences.chinese: 然無利則臣不忠，官多財寡，奈何？

sentences.english: She rarely writes cheques to support non-profitable companies.
sentences.chinese: 她可不會給無利可圖的公司寫支票。

sentences.english: Guess theres no money being the police of the globe eh?
sentences.chinese: 我猜，充當世界警察是無利可圖的吧？

sentences.english: It does not pay its handlers.
sentences.chinese: 經手此事的人無利可圖。

sentences.english: Without exception, the earliest colonial ventures were unprofitable.
sentences.chinese: 早期殖民歷險無一例外地無利可圖。

sentences.english: GG: That guy never does anything unless there's an angel in it.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙從來不會幹無利可圖的事兒。

sentences.english: Such a discount won’t leave us anything.
sentences.chinese: 給這樣一個折扣，我們就無利可圖了。

sentences.english: This leaves us no margin of profit at your terms of payment.
sentences.chinese: 按照你方付款條件我們無利可圖。

sentences.english: We wouldn't make any profits at the price you offered.
sentences.chinese: 以你方所報的價格，我們將無利可圖。

sentences.english: Career is like marriage, over time, we feel it is our only.
sentences.chinese: 職業有如婚姻，久而久之，大家只覺得它有敝無利。

sentences.english: There's no profit to be had today in protecting tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 任何爲未來所做的努力在今天都無利可圖。

sentences.english: When there is bumper crop, the market price comes down and the farmers are not able to make any profit.
sentences.chinese: 作物豐收時，市場價格下跌，農民便無利可圖。

sentences.english: Such a rush drives up the mark-franc price to the no-profit-oppprtunity point.
sentences.chinese: 這樣又會把馬克兌法郎擡高到無利可圖的價格。

definition: inner product/the dot product of two vectors
forged book/book of dubious authenticity/misattributed book/Apocrypha
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
harming others for one's personal benefit (idiom); personal gain to the detriment of others

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
